title.narrative: UNEP - Global District Energy in Cities Initiative

description.narrative:
The objective is to assist developing countries¿ cities to accelerate their transition to lower-carbon and climate resilient societies through modern district energy systems. The project contributes mainly to two of the three SE4All objectives, namely renewable energy and energy efficiency by: (i) increasing awareness on the potential of district energy and its role in achieving multiple socio-economic and environmental benefits; (ii) by strengthening the capacities of city planners, policymakers and stakeholders to develop, manage, implement and monitor district energy expansion or refurbishment strategies ; (iii) create an enabling environment that will unlock investment in district energy systems, by harnessing the private sector¿s financing and delivery capability to ensure sustainable implementation and to foster industry growth; and (iv) facilitate exchange of experiences between city/country partners on district energy innovation and best practice through a 'cities for cities' twinning process.
UNEP aims to develop the so-called District Energy Efficiency Accelerator to secure the commitments of at least 10 cities, up to 5 energy service or technology providers and 2-3 financial institutions to advance DES deployment globally. This project provides the funding for the development of the initiative, as the implementing mechanism for the SE4ALL District Energy accelerator, to facilitate the transition to district energy systems.
